snippet: Lawmakers who pressed for the resignation of Speaker John A. Boehner, particularly members of the House Freedom Caucus, could prevent any candidate from securing the 218 votes needed.
abstract: Conservative House members say frustration over their powerlessness to enact agenda they believe their constituents expected is what led to efforts to oust Speaker John Boehner, who became viewed as legislative roadblock; members of so-called Freedom Caucus see election for new speaker as chance to further their ideas of how government and House should function, given that any successful candidate will need to win support of at least some Freedom Caucus members.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers who pressed for the resignation of Speaker John A. Boehner, particularly members of the House Freedom Caucus, could prevent any candidate from securing the 218 votes needed.

headline.print_headline: Conservatives Want to Change More Than Speaker
headline.main: Hard-Line Republicans Want to Change More Than House Speaker
